bow: baby has bad diaper rash any tips my little girl 5mo seems to be really prone to diaper rash getting very light bit of it every few days we been using baby powder but now basically putting destin on every time we try to check and change her diaper as often as possible minus at night because she been sleeping through the night lately the last two days she had it little more rough not widespread but few really bad spots then today one was even bleeding little trying to be so gentle and she real trooper but when she poops have to be thorough and no matter how gentle am it still obviously hurts her it breaks my heart any advice on things can do we just moved so things are little frantic basically if it does heal in few days plan on going to an urgent care center since getting to the doc on base might be bit my child was bit jaundiced at birth and had diaper ready few days after being born it looked like second degree burn we put some olive oil and only swear by triple paste for butt cream it cleared out pretty quickly butt paste they have it at target ok ll look into getting some of that ve heard of that we ll have to try it it it good for keeping it away too naked time always helped my lo throw some towels down go outside or hang out on tile floor the more diaper free time the better aquafor is great for rash would steer clear of baby powder for the diaper area there are studies on it harmful effects another thing to try is switching diaper and wipe brands to see if there is something in your current brands that may be causing irritation my daughter had bad diaper rash all the time we used disposables changed her frequently and tried or different kinds of cream nothing worked finally we opted to give her short soak in the bath every night and naked butt time once or twice during the day gated her in the kitchen with me in case of accidents let her be naked from the waist down for maybe 30 45 minutes at time it did lot of good for her rashes were not 100 gone but far less frequent and horrible we also tried to give her minute or two to air out on the changing pad after each change before putting new diaper on hope you find something that helps my kiddo has sensitive skin she gets diaper rash from anything but water wipes we also had bad luck with honest diapers it turns out she needs the moisture to be wicked right away which some of the natural diapers don do well she does great in pampers pure or regular pampers we also love the walgreens if you re in the us purple diaper cream my 10 week old has had another rash since we started using it around weeks it great stuff know sound like that mom on the internet but coconut oil worked very well for diaper rash for my kiddos this butt paste sorry for jumping in but seriously want to emphasize that stuff is *great* it very thick so try to use just one dab and work it from there it also bit tough to wipe off after so plan to apply it for little stretch if you can would use it daily if that what you mean by keeping it away but definitely use it when you see signs of redness it works on my son with the really bad rashes he gets them after eating something new used it 13 years ago for my daughter too only bought it because the name had me cracking up but then it turned out to be awesome there red and yellow kind we used them both but did really notice if one was better than the other so would just go with the cheaper one take her to her dr and see if it yeast causing the rash my friend had daughter with the same and short course of topical nystatin cleared it up it worth check does it look like yeast diaper rash https www google com search q=yeast+diaper+rash amp prmd=isnv amp source=lnms amp tbm=isch amp sa=x amp ved=0ahukewig3zzrytndahvpfzqihdaya6gq auiesgb amp biw=768 amp bih=922 if so you can get otc antifungal like lotrimin until you can see your pediatrician try changing diapers used pampers around when they changed over to new babydry my son got weeping bleeding rash did everything we could think of before changing diapers and it healed almost immediately pampers of course claims no wrong doing even tho others complained about the new diaper as well second this if it not clearing up with naked bum time and other diaper creams in couple days yeast might be involved try triple paste it bit pricey but as current mother and former infant and toddler teacher swear by it if it doesn clear up take the baby to the doctors it could be yeast infection we use blow dryer during diaper changes just blow dry that little tushy after using wet wipes the put diaper cream aka barrier cream on there too keep the wetness off her skin my first baby had horrible bleeding rash too but my mom dropped this little nugget of wisdom on me it game changer also while we were working on drying that rash up we used warm water and soft cloth to clean her her rash cleared up in few days no baby powder naked time oatmeal baths diaper cream with zinc after bath always put lot of lotion on the area let dry and apply think layer of diaper cream we do daily bath right before bed if it really messy diaper will put her in the shower to rinse off instead of irritating it further with lot of wiping aquaphor is great for teething acidic diaper rashes triple paste is great as daily and it doesn have strong smell we ve had good luck with huggies how long does she go between diaper changes overnight ve noticed big difference when increasing the number of changes overnight unfortunately may mean waking baby up for several days until it gets under control one of my sons had bout of diaper rashes it seemed like as soon as got it to go away it come right back ended up switching his diaper brand pampers and started using non scented natural baby wipes no more bum rashes well for the most part my son has sensitive skin and *i think* that had something to do with it buttpaste and aquaphor worked for me too my 18 month old is prone to diaper rash especially after long sleep we use desitin they have both treat and prevent version we have both butt paste didn do mush for us and the honest brand and babyganic brand or whatever it is called were both total waste of money for us the two biggest helps are very frequent diaper changes and diaper free time preferably in the sun 10 15 minute increments should heal it right up also like another poster said your baby could be allergic to diaper or wipe brand we can use any pampers brand my daughter is allergic anything with scent isn great for her in general so that possibility too we now just use kirkland brand diapers and wipes and that resolved that part of the puzzle good luck to you thank you this is so good bleeding rash means yeast check the ingredients on your baby powder our pediatrician always advised against it because it made of cornstarch and will exacerbate any yeast growth the best thing for diaper rash is plenty of diaper free time and washing daily let her have some time diaperless outside the sun and air will kill off the rash then if she got red irritation apply ointment before diapering yes great product for my baby and we just wrapped his little bum loosely for day and dealt to be enjoying it at least we use this too we started out using the yellow kind but after our kiddo got few rashes we switched to the red kind it clears up redness from one diaper change to the next amazing stuff have some of that from when got my last tattoo it been while though that stuff does go bad does it might start doing the bath thing we re starting to give her naked time too hopefully naked time for sure we use the adult incontinence pads and slide those under her and let her air out for at least an hour day naked time for sure we use the adult incontinence pads and slide those case give birth at home will definitely give that go what works for us and this is literally the only thing that we ve been successful for our two sensitive skinned eczema boys warm bath with baking soda dry amp let the area air out apply dr smith at every diapering desitin butt paste aquafor—none of that works for us our pediatrician turned us on to dr smith and it is the only thing that with some baking soda also helps just dump in like quarter cup into the bath water and swish it around with your hand to mix and diffuse it if butt paste doesn do it canesten or any anti fungal and you aren wrong coconut oil is skin protectorate it repels moisture up to point used flannel to dry my son off if in rush but yup definitely letting it air out after wipe down is ideal our ped told us with or 7th generation diapers day but anymore than that or overnight and it rash city my toddler is prone to getting extreme diaper rashes couple of spots to open sores in single day bad only poops during his sleep thanks to potty training but sleeps through the night our pediatrician recommended 40 zinc oxide or higher bum cream any brand will do but we use zincofax extra strength we have had bad rash since rule out it being yeast infection they can be particularly nasty an over the counter vagisil will clear it up if yeast but doc can prescribe stronger cream in pinch plain yogurt can soothe the burn for the baby calmoseptine it in the adult diaper aisle pediatrician recommended it after ours got bleeding open sores from diaper rash it had cooling effect and reduces pain along with healing also soapless baths twice daily and air dry 15 30 minutes afterwards our pediatrician also prescribed us silver cream to reduce infection to rotate with the calmoseptine the combo works wonders baby was almost fully healed by the next day aquaphor gt butt paste for healing and preventing ve tried both yeah who knows what the factor is keep doing process of elimination until something it the bum it diaper rash but if it in the creases of the groin where legs meet front bum it probably thrush also found that some nappy brands just did agree with my son if you ve switched wipes brands that could be contributing noticed one brand irritating my bub but it was all had so use the wipes to clean the poo and then rinse the area that had touched the wipe with cotton ball and plain water to get any residual chemical off and it worked perfectly pat dry apply your preferred barrier cream and carry on that same brand now he older seems to be perfectly fine we used to use huggies but ve used pampers the last few days always unscented and they smell weird might buy different ones and just throw these out this only use wash cloths it helps tremendously yeah some brands of baby powder still contain talc which has some serious concerns about inhilation many brands that have removed talc actually use corn starch but they add other stuff to it like fragrances still go to the doctor because if it is yeast the corn starch will do more harm than good starch is complex sugar which will feed the yeast triple paste expensive but very effective also water wipes seconding this it changed our lives started using it on baby as well and it been amazing ll have to look into water wipes had very sensitive skin as baby and have eczema now so was hoping she would get it but it starting to look like she did poor thing have portable fan and point it at the butt area for less than minute try my best to do this each time if do have time for it then ll put on desitin diaper cream but ve found that airing out is the best way for my lo agree with the blow dryer suggestion also used neosporin when it got scabby and you can rinse with water instead of using wipes used my pericare bottle with warm water over her diaper before switching to dry one sometimes would just rinse her under the faucet and when going naked isn feasible use diaper several sizes too big that will help keep it from touching her rash first you should know the what causes nappy rash https www bepanthen me en learn about your skin your babys skin learn about nappy rash the most common cause of nappy rash is combination of soiled nappies and friction baby delicate skin becomes sore and fragile when in contact with the natural yet irritating chemicals in healthy urine and the irritants and enzymes in feces nappy rash is made worse by tight nappy which both rubs removing the skin protective lipids and stops air circulating if left untreated this can even lead to fungal infections such as candida albicans some baby wipes and cleaning products contain perfume alcohol and other substances that can also cause irritation being in contact with wee or poo stools for long time the nappy rubbing against your baby skin not cleaning the nappy area or changing the nappy often enough penetration of irritants alcohol based baby wipes your baby recently taking antibiotics suffering from diarrhoea nutritional deficiency biotin or zinc
